title: Esports World Cup reached over 10.5 million Indians: BARC
description: Esports World Cup: Social media influencers promoted the World Cup content, gathering a reach of more than 39 million. Popular creator Rishabh Shukla’s reel was watched 20.3 million times alone, Star Sports, the official broadcast partner of EWC told ET.
content: The first edition of Esports World Cup (EWC), which concluded last week in Saudi Arabia had a reach of 10.5 million in India and a total consumption of 64 million minutes watched, the Broadcast Audience Research Council (BARC) data showed.Although Indian players did not compete in Riyadh, social media influencers promoted the World Cup content, gathering a reach of more than 39 million. Popular creator Rishabh Shukla’s reel was watched 20.3 million times alone, Star Sports, the official broadcast partner of EWC told ET.“With close to 500 million gamers and an even larger fanbase, India is solid and a promising esports market,” said Sanjog Gupta-Head of Sports at Disney Star. “This trust is highlighted by our Prime Minister's frequent mentions of supporting the gaming industry.”As for Star Sports, we sighted this opportunity quite early when we partnered with Nodwin Gaming in 2022 as a broadcast partner to their BGMI Masters series which was the first esports franchise to be broadcast in India by the Star Sports Network, Gupta said.He explained that Indian players suffer a disadvantage when it comes to participating in global tournaments as India’s most played and most affordable game, Krafton’s Battleground Mobile India (BGMI), is not available in any other geography.
